reviews.text: The Elite Suites is a comfortable hotel with a modern decor, in a busy and growing area of Bahrain. The area is filled with new construction, but is rather devoid of restaurants or other attractions. I didn't have a car in Bahrain, but I found that I was about a twenty minute walk from the Bahrain Mall, or a fifteen minute walk in the other direction from the Dana Mall. Unfortunately, dining choices are limited if you want an alternative to the hotel restaurant, although it really wasn't bad. Each mall offers the usual franchised fast food courts, but the other choices were only an Applebee's at the Bahrain Mall, or a Chili's in the Dana Mall. Not exactly fine dining, or even interesting local dining.
reviews.title: Service is a Problem

reviews.text: The staff was pleasant enough, but from the beginning of my stay, there was a steady stream of service problems that were annoying. Reservations were made in advance for a driver from the hotel to pick me up on arrival at the Bahrain airport, but he was a no-show. I got a taxi from the airport, but the driver wandered around the Seef area, since he said there were several hotels named "Elite". When I finally arrived and mentioned the lack of transportation at the check-in desk, the clerk gave a perfunctory apology, stating that they were "very busy" that night.
reviews.title: Great Choice for Bahrain

reviews.text: I was exhausted after a long trip from the U.S., but needed Internet access that night. I called the front desk to ask how to get on, and was told that I would have to buy a voucher from them. Eventually, the clerk promised to send someone up to the room with the voucher, but that person never arrived.
reviews.title: the perfect oasis
Nice hotel, as long there is no party...
reviews.text: The bathroom had a modern shower, with two showerheads and multiple jets, but I found out quickly that the shower leaked at the bottom of the glass enclosure. So much for the modern plumbing. I complained twice to the front desk about the leak in the shower, but it was never fixed. In addition, the water never got much warmer than body temperature, and I notified the desk about that. Needless to say, that went unresolved, as well.
